author: jonm
msg: HTTPCLIENT-1101: A few changes resulting from using this in a proof-of-concept
with actual client and server applications. (1) support for separate cooldowns
for probes and backoffs, to allow for backing off immediately after a probe
that went too high; (2) ConnPoolByRoute should also close a connection if the
max pool size for the route has dropped below current usage, otherwise the
backoff doesn't work with persistent connections. This is basically working;
I'll have to write up some documentation for how to use it, then I'll merge it
down into the trunk.

author: cmpilato
msg: In anticipation of future improvements, transmit pre-calculated final
SHA1 checksums for file contents in the mod_dav_svn update response,
and receive them in ra_serf.  This should come at negligible cost to
both client and server (we are *not* asking the server to calculate
any SHA1's not already stored in the repsitory).
(Per discussion at http://svn.haxx.se/dev/archive-2011-05/0894.shtml)
* subversion/mod_dav_svn/reports/update.c
(add_helper, close_file): Grab the SHA1 checksum for files out of
the FS (if readily available), and pass it across the wire.
* subversion/libsvn_ra_serf/update.c
(report_info_t): Add 'final_sha1_checksum' member.
(start_report): Populate new 'final_sha1_checksum' report baton
member if we find that information in the REPORT response.
